model

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • model.Board

  • public final class Board
extends java.util.Observable
    A representation of a Tetris game board.
    Version:
    Autumn 2014
    Author:
    Alan Fowler

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static java.lang.String CORNER
      The representation of the board corners in string output.

      The representation of the current piece's position in string output.

      The height of a standard Tetris board.
      private static int DEFAULT_WIDTH
      The width of a standard Tetris board.
      private static java.lang.String EMPTY
      The representation of an empty grid position in string output.
      private static int EXTRA_ROWS
      The number of extra rows above the board to display in String output.
      private static java.lang.String FLOOR
      The representation of the board floor in string output.
      private static java.lang.String FROZEN
      The representation of a frozen block in string output.
      private static int MIN_SIZE
      The minimum size of a board.
      private Piece myCurrentPiece
      The piece currently being moved on the board.
      private java.util.List<Block[]> myFrozenBlocks
      The current frozen blocks on the board.
      private boolean myGameOver
      The boolean representing the game state of Tetris.
      private int myHeight
      The height of this Tetris board.
      private Piece myNextPiece
      The next piece to be used in the board.
      private java.util.Deque<Piece> myPieces
      The predetermined queue of pieces to be fed into the board.
      private int myWidth
      The width of this Tetris board.
      private static Piece NO_PIECE
      Represents the state when no current piece exists.
      private static java.util.Random RANDOM
      The random number generator used for choosing new pieces.
      private static int ROTATIONS
      The number of rotations to return a piece to initial state.
      private static java.lang.String WALL
      The representation of the side walls of the board in string output.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Board()
      Constructs a Board using default dimensions (10x20) and random pieces.

      Constructs a Board using the specified dimensions and random pieces.
      Board(int theWidth, int theHeight, java.util.Deque<Piece> thePieces)
      Constructs a Board using the specified dimensions and the specified sequence of pieces.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board(int theWidth,
             int theHeight,
             java.util.Deque<Piece> thePieces)
        Constructs a Board using the specified dimensions and the specified sequence of pieces.
        Parameters:
        theWidth - the grid width to assign to this Tetris board
        theHeight - the grid height to assign to this Tetris board
        thePieces - the sequence of pieces to use; an empty list or null indicates a random game

      • Board

        public Board(int theWidth,
             int theHeight)
        Constructs a Board using the specified dimensions and random pieces.
        Parameters:
        theWidth - the grid width to assign to this Tetris board
        theHeight - the grid height to assign to this Tetris board

      • Board

        public Board()
        Constructs a Board using default dimensions (10x20) and random pieces.

      • newGame

        public void newGame(int theWidth,
                    int theHeight,
                    java.util.Deque<Piece> thePieces)
        Creates a new game on a Board of the specified width and height and loads the given set of pieces.
        Parameters:
        theWidth - The width of the board
        theHeight - The height of the board
        thePieces - The pieces to use

        Returns:

      • randomPiece

        private Piece randomPiece(int theX,
                          int theY)
        Creates a new piece randomly chosen from the possible pieces at the specified coordinates.
        Parameters:
        theX - The x-coordinate
        theY - The y-coordinate
        Returns:
        A randomly chosen piece

      • blockAt

        private Block blockAt(int theX,
                      int theY)
        Retrieves the block at the specified coordinates.
        Parameters:
        theX - The x-coordinate
        theY - The y-coordinate
        Returns:
        The block at the specified coordinates, EMPTY if there is no block at the specified coordinates, null if the specified coordinates are outside of the board

      • currentPieceAt

        private boolean currentPieceAt(int theX,
                               int theY)
        Evaluates if the current piece occupies the provided position.
        Parameters:
        theX - The x-coordinate to examine
        theY - The y-coordinate to examine
        Returns:
        true if the current piece occupies the position, false otherwise

      • freeze

        private void freeze()
        The current piece cannot move down so add its blocks to the board.

      • clearLines

        private void clearLines()
        Checks if there are any lines that need to be cleared and removes them from the board.
